full_summary:
**Title**: Greenstone and Henry Larson Buildings, Yellowknife, NT, Building Condition Report
**Reference**: PW-_PWZ-050-11380
**Amendment**: 2
**Solicitation Number**: EW038-221678/A
**Publication Date**: 2022-11-04
**Tender Closing Date**: 2022-12-20T15:00:00
**Release**: This is a **Request for Proposal** (RFP) under the **Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)**, **Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)**, and **Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement (CPCA)**.

**Scope of Work**: Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) is seeking the services of an Architectural or Engineering firm to provide a Building Condition Report and related studies for the Greenstone Building and the Henry Larson Building in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories.

**Background**: The Greenstone Building is a four-story concrete building constructed in 2005, occupying 8,165m2 over four floors. The Henry Larson Building was built in 1970 with additions made in 1974 and 1997, with a total floor area of 2,808m2. Both buildings are occupied by various Government of Canada departments and agencies.

**Requirements**: The successful bidder must provide a Building Condition Report, which includes a detailed examination of the buildings' condition, identifying necessary repairs and capital investments. The report should be prepared in accordance with established industry standards.

** Tendering Method**: This procurement is subject to the competitive procurement strategy of **Best Overall Proposal**. Interested suppliers may submit a bid, and the selection will be based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

**documents**: Bid documents can be obtained through the Government of Canada's Web site at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/fr/occasions-de-marche](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/fr/occasions-de-marche). The deadline for submission is **December 20, 2022, at 14 h** (MST).

**Contact Information**: If you have any questions or concerns regarding this tender, please contact:

McRuer, Daniel
Supervising Procurement Specialist, Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC)
Phone: (204) 295-6634 
Fax: (418) 566-6167
Email: dan.mcruer@pwgsc-tpsg
